business.headline: Explained: Why Reliance Power shares hit 5% upper circuit today Reliance Power stock: What's behind the fresh rally? Investors are buzzing as the company makes big moves—find out what's driving the surge.

Salaried employees work longer hours than casual workers, finds surveyFor many corporate workers, these 48-hour weeks translate to roughly 9 hours of work each day if they're working five days a week, or 8 hours if it's a six-day work week.
Hyundai IPO gets Sebi clearence. Check expected listing date The company submitted its draft papers in June 2024 and the IPO may be launched as soon as October.
KRN Heat Exchanger IPO opens for bidding: Subscribe or skip? The IPO of KRN Heat Exchanger is entirely a fresh issue of 1.55 crore shares and will be open for subscription till September 27.

Gold, silver price today, September 25, 2024: Yellow metal trades higher, silver records dip on MCXGold Price Today 25 September 2024: Gold is trading on the higher side while silver rates have recorded a dip on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Wednesday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Foxconn eyes $1 billion display module plant in Tamil Nadu: ReportThis will be the first display module facility Foxconn has built in India, and it is expected to mainly support the production of Apple's iPhones.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as investors take breather after record runThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 20.70 points to 84,893.34 at 10:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 18.20 points to trade at 25,922.20.

Shankh Air ready for takeoff: All you need to know about India's new airlineShankh Air, owned by Shankh Aviation Private Limited, has been granted a No Objection Certificate (NOC) by the ministry, valid for three years.

Sensex crosses 85,000, Nifty hits 26,000: Will bull run continue on D-Street? While Sensex and Nifty closed below record highs amid volatility, analysts remain cautiously optimistic, noting that Indian equities have defied global uncertainty to post strong gains this year.

Sensex, Nifty dip after hitting record highs; Tata Steel jumps 4%The Sensex settled 14.57 points lower at 84,929.25 after crossing 85,000 for the first time, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 1.35 points higher at 25,940.40 after crossing 26,000.

NPS Vatsalya: Is it the right choice for parents?Unlike other financial products aimed at short-term goals like education or marriage, NPS Vatsalya focusses solely on long-term retirement savings for the child.

Western Carriers shares list at 1% discount. Should you hold or sell? Western Carriers market listing: The company's stock opened at Rs 170 on the BSE, which is 1.16% below its issue price of Rs 172. On the NSE, the shares listed at Rs 171, down by Rs 1, or 0.6%.

Explained: Why Exxaro Tiles shares jumped over 18% todayThe company stock price rose as much as 18.4% to Rs 94.96 in early trade. At 2 pm, shares of Exxaro Tiles were trading 17.24% higher at Rs 94.25.

Northern Arc Capital shares list at 33% premium over IPO price. Hold or sell?Northern Arc Capital IPO listing: The stock opened at Rs 351 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, up 33.5% from its issue price of Rs 263. Similarly, it listed at Rs 350 on the National Stock Exchange.

Arkade Developers shares gain 37% on listing: Should you book profit or hold?Arkade Developers stock opened at Rs 175 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, a 36.72% jump from its issue price of Rs 128. On the National Stock Exchange, the shares listed at Rs 175.90, reflecting a similar premium of 37.42%.

Paytm shares jump over 3% after Emkay's rating upgrade. More upside ahead?Paytm share price: The rally comes after Emkay Global Financial Services upgraded its rating on One97 Communications from 'Reduce' to 'Add' while doubling its target price to Rs 750 per share from the previous Rs 375.

Byju's faces setback as US court upholds $1.2 billion loan default rulingThe court's decision supports an earlier ruling made by the Delaware Court of Chancery, which allowed the company's lenders, represented by Glas Trust LLC, to seize control of Byju's Alpha Inc

JSW Group to shift Rs 40,000 crore EV project from Odisha to Maharashtra: ReportJSW Group, led by Sajjan Jindal, is now eyeing Maharashtra, with Aurangabad and Nagpur emerging as the top contenders for the large-scale EV and battery project.
Manaba Finance IPO Day 2: Check latest subscription, expected listing gains The IPO of Manba Finnace is a fresh issue of 1.26 crore shares and closes for subscription on September 25, 2024.

Vodafone Idea shares fall 2% as ICICI Securities cuts target price ICICI Securities has reduced Vodafone Idea's EV/EBITDA multiple to 13 times FY27 from 14 times and lowered its target price to Rs 11 from Rs 15.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: I take my words back: Kangana Ranaut after BJP raps her over farm laws remark As her comments drew sharp criticism from the BJP, Kangana Ranaut issued a public apology, stating, "I take my words back."

Who's who of politics, films, tech to converge at India Today's Mumbai ConclaveThis year's conclave in Mumbai promises to be a riveting affair, coming on the heels of the high-voltage Lok Sabha elections and weeks ahead of the Maharashtra Assembly polls.

Supreme Court rebukes High Court judge: Can't call any part of India as PakistanThe Supreme Court said a person cannot describe any region of India as "Pakistan" while taking note of a controversial remark on a Bengaluru locality by High Court judge Justice V Srishananda during a recent hearing.

Bank staffer dies in office, Akhilesh Yadav blames BJP policies for work stressThe incident comes amid a nationwide outrage over the death of an Ernst and Young employee in Pune allegedly due to 'excessive workload'.

Can ChatGPT fact-check your Bumble date's real height?Social media has recently been flooded with posts of women using ChatGPT to check whether their matches on dating apps like Hinge, Bumble, or Tinder are lying about their height.

What's Iron Dome's success rate, cost of shooting down missile? 7 FAQs answeredVideos of Israel's Iron Dome shooting down rockets fired by Hezbollah and lighting up the night sky went viral. Though the Iron Dome is well known, there are some frequently asked questions (FAQs) like what is its success rate, how much does it cost to shoot down a missile, and how it feels on the ground? Here are answers to some of the FAQs.

When I said 75% issues sorted, I meant...: S Jaishankar on China border rowExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar touched upon the India-China border tensions and said that disengagement of troops was only done when he meant that 75 per cent of the dispute had been sorted.

Odisha custodial assault: Army veterans seek action, question silence of PM The letter, written by senior veterans under the banner of the Indian Ex-Services League (IESL), questioned the silence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi over the assault on an Army officer's fiancée in Odisha, and called for action from the top leadership.

Indian-origin techie makes wearable device that captures your life every minuteAdvait Paliwal, an Indian-origin entrepreneur based in San Francisco has developed Iris, an AI-based wearable device, which captures pictures of a person's life every minute.
S Jaishankar confident of continued 'positive' ties with Sri Lanka, Bangladesh External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar's remarks came in light of the change of government in Sri Lanka and Bangladesh.

Video: Dance at Chennai doctors' conference triggers row for being 'vulgar'A dance performance at a Chennai medical conference has triggered a row. Several social media users shared the video and questioned the event, criticising the event for its "vulgarity".

Why are you still here, entrepreneur asks those criticising India, gets slammedNiraj Dugar, co-founder of financial planning and distribution firm Holistic Prime Wealth, implied in his post that those who "continuously find faults in India" should reconsider their decision to live in the country.

Watch: Toddler appears to drink beer at football game in Texas, mother ignoresThe incident occurred at the packed Darrell K Royal-Texas Memorial Stadium in Austin, where the little girl was filmed taking three hearty gulps from what appeared to be a can of Michelob Ultra.

Leopard captured in Bengaluru weeks after being spotted in tech hubThe captutred leopard is expected to be shifted to the Bannerghatta Biological Park. A video surfaced last week, showing the leopard crossing a flyover road around 3 am.

Don't want to be sandwiched between China and India: New Sri Lanka PresidentIn an interview, the new Sri Lankan President said that the island nation would not align itself with any 'power camp' and that both India and China are valued friends.

Brisk voting in 2nd phase of J&K Assembly polls, foreign diplomats in Srinagar Live UpdatesThe People's Democratic Party has fielded 26 candidates, the highest number, followed by the National Conference with 20, BJP with 17, and the Congress with six. There are 170 independent and other candidates.

Are Urmila Matondkar, husband Mohsin getting a divorce? Here's the truthRumours are rife that actor-politician Urmila Matondkar and her husband Mohsin Akhtar Mir are getting a divorce. Sources close to the couple exclusively told India Today Digital that they're indeed separated.

Pawan Kalyan addresses Karthi's apology on Tirupathi laddu comment, Suriya respondsTamil actor Suriya thanked Pawan Kalyan after he addressed Karthi's apology over the laddu controversy. Karthi's comments sparked mixed reactions in the industry.

Video: UK PM calls for return of 'sausages' from Gaza. He meant hostagesUK Prime Minister Keir Starmer made a gaffe when he said "return of sausages" instead of "return of hostages" while urging the release of Israeli civilians by Hamas in Gaza.

High Court on elderly couple's alimony battle: Seems Kalyug has arrivedDuring the hearing, Justice Saurabh Shyam Shamshery also said that such legal battles were a matter of concern, while also trying to advise the couple.

Film Federation of India jury head on Laapataa Ladies's citationIn an exclusive interview with India Today, filmmaker Jahnu Barua, who headed the 13-member committee that made the unanimous decision to select Laapataa Ladies for Oscar 2025, said that the film stood out as it highlighted several issues uniquely related to women.

No one called me: Vinesh Phogat claims lack of support in OlympicsWrestler Vinesh Phogat said that she lacked support when she took part in the Paris Olympics where she was disqualified from her 50kg final bout.

Watch: Virat Kohli awkwardly turns down Kanpur hotel staff's handshakeVirat Kohli was forced to turn down Kanpur hotel staff's handshake upon his arrival ahead of the second Test against Bangladesh. The star Indian batter compensated with a "Thank You".

UP man gets life term for raping mother, asking her to live with him as wifeA 36-year-old man was sentenced to life imprisonment for raping his 60-year-old widowed mother and asking her to live with him as his wife in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr.
Alia Bhatt praises Jigra co-star Vedang Raina: He reminded me of Ranveer Singh Alia Bhatt praised her Jigra co-star Vedang Raina, comparing him to Ranveer Singh. She also called Raina an old soul.

Parineeti Chopra's adorable anniversary wish for husband Raghav ChadhaParineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha celebrated their first wedding anniversary on September 24. On the occasion, Parineeti shared the cutest anniversary wish for her husband, Raghav Chadha.

Rashmika Mandanna visits temple, prays for fansActor Rashmika Mandanna shared a special message for fans on social media. The actor revealed that she had gone to a temple and prayed for everyone's well-being.

Tanuj Virwani-Tanya Jacob welcome baby girl: First day of the rest of our livesTV actor Tanuj Virwani and his wife Tanya Jacob welcomed their first child, a baby girl. They shared the happy announcement on September 24.

sports.headline: 'Fit' Andre Russell wants to play T20 World Cup 2026: 'Why should I stop?'Star West Indies all-rounder Andre Russell wants to continue till the T20 World Cup 2026. Speaking ahead of the series against Sri Lanka, Russell said that he has set a timeline for himself in the T20I format.

Harry Brook responds to 1st AUS ODI remarks critics: People took it a bit wrongEngland captain Harry Brook claimed that people took his comments after the 1st ODI a little bit wrong. Brook scored his maiden hundred on September 24 against Australia as England clawed their way back into the series.

England's women domestic players to be granted basic salary equality from 2025England will offer equal starting salaries to men and women across professional domestic cricket from next year, the country's cricket board said on Tuesday.

'Ash anna' bullied, Yashasvi feels like Tendulkar as Team India reaches KanpurThe Indian team arrived in Kanpur in high spirits as the players were seen having some banter during their trip from Chennai. India will face Bangladesh in the second Test, starting from September 27.

Learning at every step: Vikrampratap Singh on a mission to best himselfIndia and Mumbai City FC forward Vikrampratap Singh Sandhu is on a mission to better his previous season's achievements in the Indian Super League. Despite a challenging start for Mumbai City, the 22-year-old is determined to score more goals and assists to drive his team to victory once again.

Gujarat teenager plays marathon 498-run knock in school cricketGujarat's Drona Desai made history by scoring 498 runs in an under-19 cricket match, joining an elite list of young cricketers. Drona ensured a dominant victory for St. Xavier's (Loyola) by an innings and 712 runs.

Olympiad gold or World No.3 ranking? Arjun Erigaisi reveals his favouriteArjun Erigaisi has revealed that he values the Chess Olympiad gold more than his new World ranking of No.3. Erigaisi got his new ranking after his splendid performance at the Chess Olympiad, where India won a double gold.

England's Mark Wood told not to lift kids up after elbow fractureEngland's fast bowler Mark Wood had been instructed to avoid using his right arm due to a stress injury in his elbow. The injury will keep him out for the remainder of 2024, affecting key tours and matches.

'Irreplaceable' Rodri out for a long time: Manchester City boss Pep GuardiolaManchester City manager Pep Guardiola has confirmed that Rodri will be out "for a long time" because of a knee injury he suffered against Arsenal.
Harmanpreet Kaur-led Indian team leaves for UAEThe Harmanpreet Kaur-led side has left for ICC Women's T20 World Cup 2024 which is all set to take place in the United Arab Emirates (UAE).

Stokes ready for England white-ball return under coach Brendon McCullumEngland Test captain Ben Stokes has opened the door to a possible return to white-ball cricket under coach Brendon McCullum, though no formal talks have occurred. Stokes emphasises his current focus on the upcoming Test series in Pakistan.

After WBBL snub, India's Shreyanka Patil aims to become the 'best all-rounder'India's Shreyanka Patil has set her goal of becoming a quality all-rounder after not finding a team in the WBBL. In an exclusive interview with Indiatodayin, Shreyanka also spoke about her memorable season with RCB in the WPL 2024.

Harry Brook's maiden ODI hundred keeps England afloat in ODI series  ENG vs AUS: Harry Brook scored 110 runs off 94 balls as England made it 1-2 in the series with a 46-run win over Australia at the Riverside Ground in Chester-Le-Street.

La Liga President reveals Barcelona are clear to sign Ter Stegen's replacementLa Liga President Javier Tebas confirmed that FC Barcelona can sign a replacement for injured goalkeeper Marc-Andre ter Stegen outside the transfer window, provided they adhere to financial fair play rules, leaving the club with a crucial decision.

Sachin wishes son Arjun on birthday: 'Your love for life inspires me'Sachin Tendulkar penned a heartfelt message for son Arjun on his 25th birthday, praising his dedication to cricket and life. Despite setbacks, Arjun's resilience continues to inspire, following his best-ever first-class bowling performance for Goa.

Nathan Lyon reveals game plan against old foe Rishabh Pant before AUS vs IND TestsNathan Lyon revealed his game plan against old foe, Rishabh Pant, in the lead-up to the Border Gavaskar Trophy series. Interestingly, Lyon has dismissed Pant in five out of the seven encounters.

Best team India are going forward with for T20 World Cup: Harmanpreet KaurWomen's T20 World Cup 2024: Harmanpreet Kaur said that the Indian team has prepared well and have all their boxes ticked before they head to the United Arab Emirates for the upcoming event.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
